trans-unit.source: Provides a type converter that can retrieve a list of data members from the current component's selected data source.
<xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataMemberConverter> provides methods that can retrieve a list of data members from the current data source of a design-time component.
This type converter is used by [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)] to provide the values that appear in the list of data members in the Properties window.
You should never access a type converter directly.
Instead, call the appropriate converter by using <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90373a3f-d8c8-492d-841c-945d62393c56).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DataFieldConverter"></xref> class.
Gets a value indicating whether the converter can convert an object of the specified source type to the native type of the converter.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that can be used to gain additional context information.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the type you wish to convert from.
`true` if the converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, `false`.
Converts the specified object to the native type of the converter.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that can be used to gain additional context information.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> that can be used to support localization features.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to convert.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the specified object after conversion.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Gets the data members present within the selected data source, if information about them is available.
The converter uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceProvider> implementation of the associated component's designer to retrieve the current data source selection.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object indicating the component or control to get values for.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> listing the data members of the data source selected for the component.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection of standard values returned from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues"></xref> is a list of all possible values.
If the list is exclusive, such as in an enumeration data type, then no other values are valid.
If the list is not exclusive, then there are other valid values besides the list of standard values that <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> provides.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that provides a format context.

`true` if the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> returned from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues"></xref> is an exclusive list of all possible values that are valid; `false` if other values are possible.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the converter supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that can be used to gain additional context information.
`true` if <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues"></xref> should be called to find a common set of values the object supports; otherwise, `false`.
This implementation always returns `true`.
